profile.title: USDA Plants Database
profile.note: USDA plant profile pages are JavaScript-rendered. Full data extraction requires browser automation (Selenium/Playwright).

profile_page.note: Full HTML not stored in JSON. Use browser automation for complete data extraction.

fact_sheet_pdf.note: PDF content stored separately. Use PDF parsing library to extract structured data.

extracted_data.factsheet_text:
Plant Fact Sheet
BEARBERRY trailing stems will layer, sending out small roots
periodically. The finely textured velvety branches
Arctostaphylos uva-ursi (L.) are initially white to pale green, becoming smooth
and red-brown with maturity. The small solitary
Spreng
three scaled buds are dark brown.
Plant Symbol = ARUV
The simple leaves of this broadleaf evergreen are
alternately arranged on branches. Each leaf is held
Contributed by: USDA NRCS Plant Materials
by a twisted leaf stalk, vertically. The leathery dark
Program
green leaves are an inch long and have rounded tips
tapering back to the base. In fall, the leaves begin
changing from a dark green to a reddish-green to
purple.
Terminal clusters of small urn-shaped flowers bloom
from May to June. The perfect flowers are white to
pink, and bear round, fleshy or mealy, bright red to
pink fruits called drupes. This smooth, glossy
skinned fruit will range from 1/4 to 1/2 inch in
diameter. The fruit will persist on the plant into early
wint
